026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets.snippet;
027
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.Iterator;
030import java.util.LinkedList;
031import java.util.List;
032import java.util.Map;
033import java.util.Objects;
034import java.util.Optional;
035import java.util.Queue;
036import java.util.Set;
037import java.util.regex.Matcher;
038import java.util.regex.Pattern;
039import java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException;
040
041import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Resources;
042import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets.SnippetTaglet;
043
044/*
045 * Semantics of a EOL comment; plus
046 * 1. This parser treats input as plain text. This may result in markup being
047 * produced from unexpected places; for example, when parsing Java text blocks:
048 *
049 *     String text =
050 *         """
051 *             // @start x
052 *         """;
053 *
054 * false positives are possible, but false negatives are not.
055 * To remediate that, perhaps a no-op trailing // @start x @end x might be added.
056 *
057 * 2. To allow some preexisting constructs, unknown actions in a leading position are skipped;
058 * for example, "// @formatter:on" marker in IntelliJ IDEA is ignored.
059 *
060 * 3. This match's value can be confused for a trailing markup.
061 *
062 *     String x; // comment // another comment // @formatter:on // @highlight match="// @"
063 *
064 * Do we need escapes?
065 *
066 * 4. Rules for EOL are very different among formats: compare Java's // with properties' #/!
067 *
068 * 5. A convenience `end` ends all the things started so far.
069 */
070/**
071 * A parser of snippet content.
072 */
073public final class Parser {
074
075    private static final Pattern JAVA_COMMENT = Pattern.compile(
076        "^(?<payload>.*)//(?<markup>\\s*@\\s*\\w+.+?)$");
077    private static final Pattern PROPERTIES_COMMENT = Pattern.compile(
078        "^(?<payload>[ \t]*([#!].*)?)[#!](?<markup>\\s*@\\s*\\w+.+?)$");
079
080    private final Resources resources;
081    private final MarkupParser markupParser;
082
083    // Incomplete actions waiting for their complementary @end
084    private final Regions regions = new Regions();
085    private final Queue<Tag> tags = new LinkedList<>();
086
087    public Parser(Resources resources) {
088        this.resources = resources;
089        this.markupParser = new MarkupParser(resources);
090    }
091
092    public Result parse(SnippetTaglet.Diags diags,
093            Optional<SnippetTaglet.Language> language, String source)
094            throws ParseException {
095        SnippetTaglet.Language lang
096            = language.orElse(SnippetTaglet.Language.JAVA);
097        var p = switch (lang) {
098        case JAVA -> JAVA_COMMENT;
099        case PROPERTIES -> PROPERTIES_COMMENT;
100        };
101        return parse(diags, p, source);
102    }
103
104    /*
105     * Newline characters in the returned text are of the \n form.
106     */
107    private Result parse(SnippetTaglet.Diags diags, Pattern commentPattern,
108            String source) throws ParseException {
109        Objects.requireNonNull(commentPattern);
110        Objects.requireNonNull(source);
111
112        Matcher markedUpLine = commentPattern.matcher(""); // reusable matcher
113
114        tags.clear();
115        regions.clear();
116
117        Queue<Action> actions = new LinkedList<>();
118
119        StyledText text = new StyledText();
120        boolean trailingNewline
121            = source.endsWith("\r") || source.endsWith("\n");
122        int lineStart = 0;
123        List<Tag> previousLineTags = new ArrayList<>();
124        List<Tag> thisLineTags = new ArrayList<>();
125        List<Tag> tempList = new ArrayList<>();
126
127        // while lines could be computed lazily, it would yield more complex
128        // code
129        record OffsetAndLine(int offset, String line) {
130        }
131        var offsetAndLines = new LinkedList<OffsetAndLine>();
132        forEachLine(source,
133            (off, line) -> offsetAndLines.add(new OffsetAndLine(off, line)));
134        Iterator<OffsetAndLine> iterator = offsetAndLines.iterator();
135
136        while (iterator.hasNext()) {
137            // There are 3 cases:
138            // 1. The pattern that describes a marked-up line is not matched
139            // 2. While the pattern is matched, the markup is not recognized
140            // 3. Both the pattern is matched and the markup is recognized
141            OffsetAndLine next = iterator.next();
142            String rawLine = next.line();
143            boolean addLineTerminator = iterator.hasNext() || trailingNewline;
144            String line;
145            boolean hasMarkup = false;
146            markedUpLine.reset(rawLine);
147            if (!markedUpLine.matches()) { // (1)
148                line = rawLine + (addLineTerminator ? "\n" : "");
149            } else {
150                String maybeMarkup
151                    = rawLine.substring(markedUpLine.start("markup"));
152                List<Tag> parsedTags;
153                try {
154                    parsedTags = markupParser.parse(maybeMarkup);
155                } catch (ParseException e) {
156                    // translate error position from markup to file line
157                    throw new ParseException(e::getMessage, next.offset()
158                        + markedUpLine.start("markup") + e.getPosition());
159                }
160                for (Tag t : parsedTags) {
161                    t.lineSourceOffset = next.offset();
162                    t.markupLineOffset = markedUpLine.start("markup");
163                }
164                thisLineTags.addAll(parsedTags);
165                for (var tagIterator = thisLineTags.iterator();
166                        tagIterator.hasNext();) {
167                    Tag t = tagIterator.next();
168                    if (t.appliesToNextLine) {
169                        tagIterator.remove();
170                        t.appliesToNextLine = false; // clear the flag
171                        tempList.add(t);
172                    }
173                }
174                if (parsedTags.isEmpty()) { // (2)
175                    diags.warn(
176                        resources.getText("doclet.snippet.markup.spurious"),
177                        next.offset() + markedUpLine.start("markup"));
178                    line = rawLine + (addLineTerminator ? "\n" : "");
179                } else { // (3)
180                    hasMarkup = true;
181                    String payload
182                        = rawLine.substring(0, markedUpLine.end("payload"));
183                    line = payload + (addLineTerminator ? "\n" : "");
184                }
185            }
186
187            thisLineTags.addAll(0, previousLineTags); // prepend!
188            previousLineTags.clear();
189            for (Tag t : thisLineTags) {
190                t.start = lineStart;
191                t.end = lineStart + line.length(); // this includes line
192                                                   // terminator, if any
193                processTag(t);
194            }
195            previousLineTags.addAll(tempList);
196            tempList.clear();
197
198            thisLineTags.clear();
199
200            append(text,
201                line.isBlank() && hasMarkup ? Set.of(new Style.Markup())
202                    : Set.of(),
203                line);
204            // TODO: mark up trailing whitespace!
205            lineStart += line.length();
206        }
207
208        if (!previousLineTags.isEmpty()) {
209            Tag t = previousLineTags.iterator().next();
210            String message = resources
211                .getText("doclet.snippet.markup.tag.non.existent.lines");
212            throw new ParseException(() -> message, t.lineSourceOffset
213                + t.markupLineOffset + t.nameLineOffset);
214        }
215
216        for (var t : tags) {
217
218            // Translate a list of attributes into a more convenient form
219            Attributes attributes = new Attributes(t.attributes());
220
221            final var substring
222                = attributes.get("substring", Attribute.Valued.class);
223            final var regex = attributes.get("regex", Attribute.Valued.class);
224
225            if (!t.name().equals("start") && substring.isPresent()
226                && regex.isPresent()) {
227                throw newParseException(t.lineSourceOffset + t.markupLineOffset
228                    + substring.get().nameStartPosition(),
229                    "doclet.snippet.markup.attribute.simultaneous.use",
230                    "substring", "regex");
231            }
232
233            switch (t.name()) {
234            case "link" -> {
235                var target = attributes.get("target", Attribute.Valued.class)
236                    .orElseThrow(() -> newParseException(t.lineSourceOffset
237                        + t.markupLineOffset + t.nameLineOffset,
238                        "doclet.snippet.markup.attribute.absent", "target"));
239                // "type" is what HTML calls an enumerated attribute
240                var type = attributes.get("type", Attribute.Valued.class);
241                String typeValue
242                    = type.isPresent() ? type.get().value() : "link";
243                if (!typeValue.equals("link")
244                    && !typeValue.equals("linkplain")) {
245                    throw newParseException(
246                        t.lineSourceOffset + t.markupLineOffset
247                            + type.get().valueStartPosition(),
248                        "doclet.snippet.markup.attribute.value.invalid",
249                        typeValue);
250                }
251                AddStyle a = new AddStyle(new Style.Link(target.value()),
252                    // the default regex is different so as not to include
253                    // newline
254                    createRegexPattern(substring, regex, ".+",
255                        t.lineSourceOffset + t.markupLineOffset),
256                    text.subText(t.start(), t.end()));
257                actions.add(a);
258            }
259            case "replace" -> {
260                var replacement
261                    = attributes.get("replacement", Attribute.Valued.class)
262                        .orElseThrow(() -> newParseException(t.lineSourceOffset
263                            + t.markupLineOffset + t.nameLineOffset,
264                            "doclet.snippet.markup.attribute.absent",
265                            "replacement"));
266                Replace a = new Replace(replacement.value(),
267                    createRegexPattern(substring, regex,
268                        t.lineSourceOffset + t.markupLineOffset),
269                    text.subText(t.start(), t.end()));
270                actions.add(a);
271            }
272            case "highlight" -> {
273                var type = attributes.get("type", Attribute.Valued.class);
274
275                String typeValue
276                    = type.isPresent() ? type.get().value() : "bold";
277
278                AddStyle a = new AddStyle(new Style.Name(typeValue),
279                    createRegexPattern(substring, regex,
280                        t.lineSourceOffset + t.markupLineOffset),
281                    text.subText(t.start(), t.end()));
282                actions.add(a);
283            }
284            case "start" -> {
285                var region = attributes.get("region", Attribute.Valued.class)
286                    .orElseThrow(() -> newParseException(t.lineSourceOffset
287                        + t.markupLineOffset + t.nameLineOffset,
288                        "doclet.snippet.markup.attribute.absent", "region"));
289                String regionValue = region.value();
290                if (regionValue.isBlank()) {
291                    throw newParseException(
292                        t.lineSourceOffset + t.markupLineOffset
293                            + region.valueStartPosition(),
294                        "doclet.snippet.markup.attribute.value.invalid");
295                }
296                for (Attribute a : t.attributes) {
297                    if (!a.name().equals("region")) {
298                        throw newParseException(t.lineSourceOffset +
299                            t.markupLineOffset + a.nameStartPosition(),
300                            "doclet.snippet.markup.attribute.unexpected");
301                    }
302                }
303                actions.add(new Bookmark(region.value(),
304                    text.subText(t.start(), t.end() - 1)));
305            }
306            }
307        }
308
309        // also report on unpaired with corresponding `end` or unknown tags
310        if (!regions.isEmpty()) {
311            Optional<Tag> tag = regions.removeLast(); // any of these tags would
312                                                      // do
313            Tag t = tag.get();
314            String message
315                = resources.getText("doclet.snippet.markup.region.unpaired");
316            throw new ParseException(() -> message, t.lineSourceOffset
317                + t.markupLineOffset + t.nameLineOffset);
318        }
319
320        return new Result(text, actions);
321    }
322
323    private ParseException newParseException(int pos, String key,
324            Object... args) {
325        String message = resources.getText(key, args);
326        return new ParseException(() -> message, pos);
327    }
328
329    private Pattern createRegexPattern(Optional<Attribute.Valued> substring,
330            Optional<Attribute.Valued> regex,
331            int offset) throws ParseException {
332        return createRegexPattern(substring, regex, "(?s).+", offset);
333    }
334
335    private Pattern createRegexPattern(Optional<Attribute.Valued> substring,
336            Optional<Attribute.Valued> regex,
337            String defaultRegex,
338            int offset) throws ParseException {
339        Pattern pattern;
340        if (substring.isPresent()) {
341            // this Pattern.compile *cannot* throw an exception
342            pattern = Pattern.compile(Pattern.quote(substring.get().value()));
343        } else if (regex.isEmpty()) {
344            // this Pattern.compile *should not* throw an exception
345            pattern = Pattern.compile(defaultRegex);
346        } else {
347            final String value = regex.get().value();
348            try {
349                pattern = Pattern.compile(value);
350            } catch (PatternSyntaxException e) {
351                // Unlike string literals in Java source, attribute values in
352                // snippet markup do not use escape sequences. This is why
353                // indices of characters in the regex pattern directly map to
354                // their corresponding positions in snippet source. Refine
355                // position using e.getIndex() only if that index is relevant to
356                // the regex in the attribute value. Index might be irrelevant
357                // because it refers to an internal representation of regex,
358                // e.getPattern(), which might be a normalized or partial view
359                // of the original pattern.
360                int pos = offset + regex.get().valueStartPosition();
361                if (e.getIndex() > -1 && value.equals(e.getPattern())) {
362                    pos += e.getIndex();
363                }
364                // getLocalized cannot be used because it provides a localized
365                // version of getMessage(), which in the case of this particular
366                // exception is multi-line with the caret. If we used that,
367                // it would duplicate the information we're trying to provide.
368                String message
369                    = resources.getText("doclet.snippet.markup.regex.invalid");
370                throw new ParseException(() -> message, pos);
371            }
372        }
373        return pattern;
374    }
375
376    private void processTag(Tag t) throws ParseException {
377
378        Attributes attributes = new Attributes(t.attributes()); // TODO: avoid
379                                                                // creating
380                                                                // attributes
381                                                                // twice
382        Optional<Attribute> region = attributes.get("region", Attribute.class);
383
384        if (!t.name().equals("end")) {
385            tags.add(t);
386            if (region.isPresent()) {
387                if (region.get() instanceof Attribute.Valued v) {
388                    String name = v.value();
389                    if (!regions.addNamed(name, t)) {
390                        throw newParseException(
391                            t.lineSourceOffset + t.markupLineOffset
392                                + v.valueStartPosition(),
393                            "doclet.snippet.markup.region.duplicated", name);
394                    }
395                } else {
396                    // TODO: change to exhaustive switch after "Pattern Matching
397                    // for switch" is implemented
398                    assert region.get() instanceof Attribute.Valueless;
399                    regions.addAnonymous(t);
400                }
401            }
402        } else {
403            if (region.isEmpty()
404                || region.get() instanceof Attribute.Valueless) {
405                Optional<Tag> tag = regions.removeLast();
406                if (tag.isEmpty()) {
407                    throw newParseException(
408                        t.lineSourceOffset + t.markupLineOffset
409                            + t.nameLineOffset,
410                        "doclet.snippet.markup.region.none");
411                }
412                completeTag(tag.get(), t);
413            } else {
414                assert region.get() instanceof Attribute.Valued;
415                String name = ((Attribute.Valued) region.get()).value();
416                Optional<Tag> tag = regions.removeNamed(name);
417                if (tag.isEmpty()) {
418                    throw newParseException(
419                        t.lineSourceOffset + t.markupLineOffset
420                            + region.get().nameStartPosition(),
421                        "doclet.snippet.markup.region.unpaired", name);
422                }
423                completeTag(tag.get(), t);
424            }
425        }
426    }
427
428    static final class Tag {
429
430        String name;
431        int lineSourceOffset;
432        int markupLineOffset;
433        int nameLineOffset;
434        int start;
435        int end;
436        List<Attribute> attributes;
437        boolean appliesToNextLine;
438
439        String name() {
440            return name;
441        }
442
443        List<Attribute> attributes() {
444            return attributes;
445        }
446
447        int start() {
448            return start;
449        }
450
451        int end() {
452            return end;
453        }
454
455        @Override
456        public String toString() {
457            return "Tag{" +
458                "name='" + name + '\'' +
459                ", start=" + start +
460                ", end=" + end +
461                ", attributes=" + attributes +
462                '}';
463        }
464    }
465
466    private void completeTag(Tag start, Tag end) {
467        assert !start.name().equals("end") : start;
468        assert end.name().equals("end") : end;
469        start.end = end.end();
470    }
471
472    private void append(StyledText text, Set<Style> style, CharSequence s) {
473        text.subText(text.length(), text.length()).replace(style, s.toString());
474    }
475
476    public record Result(StyledText text, Queue<Action> actions) {
477    }
478
479    /*
480     * Encapsulates the data structure used to manage regions.
481     *
482     * boolean-returning commands return true if succeed and false if fail.
483     */
484    public static final class Regions {
485
486        /*
487         * LinkedHashMap does not fit here because of both the need for unique
488         * keys for anonymous regions and inability to easily access the most
489         * recently put entry.
490         *
491         * Since we expect only a few regions, a list will do.
492         */
493        private final ArrayList<Map.Entry<Optional<String>, Tag>> tags
494            = new ArrayList<>();
495
496        void addAnonymous(Tag i) {
497            tags.add(Map.entry(Optional.empty(), i));
498        }
499
500        boolean addNamed(String name, Tag i) {
501            boolean matches = tags.stream()
502                .anyMatch(entry -> entry.getKey().isPresent()
503                    && entry.getKey().get().equals(name));
504            if (matches) {
505                return false; // won't add a duplicate
506            }
507            tags.add(Map.entry(Optional.of(name), i));
508            return true;
509        }
510
511        Optional<Tag> removeNamed(String name) {
512            for (var iterator = tags.iterator(); iterator.hasNext();) {
513                var entry = iterator.next();
514                if (entry.getKey().isPresent()
515                    && entry.getKey().get().equals(name)) {
516                    iterator.remove();
517                    return Optional.of(entry.getValue());
518                }
519            }
520            return Optional.empty();
521        }
522
523        Optional<Tag> removeLast() {
524            if (tags.isEmpty()) {
525                return Optional.empty();
526            }
527            Map.Entry<Optional<String>, Tag> e = tags.remove(tags.size() - 1);
528            return Optional.of(e.getValue());
529        }
530
531        void clear() {
532            tags.clear();
533        }
534
535        boolean isEmpty() {
536            return tags.isEmpty();
537        }
538    }
539
540    /*
541     * The reason that the lines are split using a custom method as opposed to
542     * String.split(String) or String.lines() is that along with the lines
543     * themselves we also need their offsets in the originating input to supply
544     * to diagnostic exceptions should they arise.
545     *
546     * The reason that "\n|(\r\n)|\r" is used instead of "\\R" is that the
547     * latter is UNICODE-aware, which we must be not.
548     */
549    static void forEachLine(String s, LineConsumer consumer) {
550        // the fact that the regex alternation is *ordered* is used here to try
551        // to match \r\n before \r
552        final Pattern NEWLINE = Pattern.compile("\n|(\r\n)|\r");
553        Matcher matcher = NEWLINE.matcher(s);
554        int pos = 0;
555        while (matcher.find()) {
556            consumer.accept(pos, s.substring(pos, matcher.start()));
557            pos = matcher.end();
558        }
559        if (pos < s.length())
560            consumer.accept(pos, s.substring(pos));
561    }
562
563    /*
564     * This interface is introduced to encapsulate the matching mechanics so
565     * that it wouldn't be obtrusive to the client code.
566     */
567    @FunctionalInterface
568    interface LineConsumer {
569        void accept(int offset, String line);
570    }
571}
